org.jruyi.io

Interface IUnit

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IByteSequence

    public interface IUnit
extends IByteSequence
    A buffer unit, which contains a linear, finite sequence of bytes and has the following 4 properties: start, size, position and mark.
    • start is the index of the first byte of the byte sequence this unit represents. It is never negative and is always smaller than capacity().
    • size is the number of bytes that the underlying buffer contains. It is never negative.
    • position is the offset (to start) of the next byte to be read. It is never negative and is never greater than size.
    • mark is the offset (to start) to which position will be reset when the method reset is invoked. It is never negative and is never greater than position. Its initial value is 0.

    Note

    All operations defined in this interface may not do bounds checking. So caller/consumer has to do bounds checking when consuming this interface.

    See Also:
    IUnitChain, IBuffer, IBufferFactory

      Tests if this buffer unit can be appended more.
      int available()
      Returns the number of bytes available in this buffer unit to be written.

      Returns the number of bytes that this buffer unit can hold.
      void clear()
      Clears this buffer unit.
      void compact()
      Compacts this buffer unit by dropping all the data before the current position.

      Creates a new buffer unit that shares this buffer unit's content.

      Decodes the requested sequence of bytes to the given double array dst starting at dstBegin in native byte order.

      Decodes the requested sequence of bytes to the given float array dst starting at dstBegin in native byte order.

      Decodes the requested sequence of bytes to the given short array dst starting at dstBegin in native byte order.
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBufferForRead()
      Returns the ByteBuffer associated to this buffer unit, with limit being this unit's (start + size) and position being this unit's (start + position).
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBufferForRead(int offset, int length)
      Returns the ByteBuffer associated to this buffer unit, with limit being this unit's (start + Math.min((offset + length), size)) and position being this unit's (start + offset).
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBufferForWrite()
      Returns the ByteBuffer associated to this buffer unit, with limit being this buffer unit's capacity and position being this buffer unit's (start + size).
      void getBytes(int srcBegin, int srcEnd, java.nio.ByteBuffer dst)
      Copies the requested sequence of bytes to the given dst.
      double getDouble(int index)
      Decodes 8 bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into a double value in the native byte order and returns the resultant double value.
      float getFloat(int index)
      Decodes 4 bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into a float value in the native byte order and returns the resultant float value.
      int getInt(int index)
      Decodes 4 bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into an int value in the native byte order and returns the resultant int value.
      long getLong(int index)
      Decodes 8 bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into a long value in the native byte order and returns the resultant long value.
      short getShort(int index)
      Decodes 2 bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into a short value in the native byte order and returns the resultant short value.

      • set

        IUnit set(int index,
          IByteSequence src,
          int srcBegin,
          int srcEnd)
        Sets (srcEnd - srcBegin) bytes starting at the specified index to the ones contained in the given byte sequence src, starting at the specified srcBegin.
        Parameters:
        index - the offset of the first byte to be set
        src - the bytes from which to set
        srcBegin - the offset of the byte in src to set as the first byte
        srcEnd - the offset of the byte in src to set as the last byte
        Returns:
        this buffer unit
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or not smaller than capacity(), minus (srcEnd - srcBegin), or srcBegin is negative, or srcEnd is smaller than srcBegin, or srcEnd is greater than src.length()

        void mark(int mark)
        Sets the mark of this buffer unit to the given position.
        Parameters:

      • appendable

        boolean appendable()
        Tests if this buffer unit can be appended more.
        Returns:
        true if appendable, otherwise false

      • prependable

        boolean prependable()
        Tests if this buffer unit can be prepended more.
        Returns:
        true if prependable, otherwise false

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Tests if this buffer unit is empty.
        Returns:
        true if empty, otherwise false

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets this buffer unit's position to the previously-marked position.

      • rewind

        void rewind()
        Rewinds this buffer unit. The position and mark are set to 0.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears this buffer unit. The start, position, mark and size are all set to 0.

      • compact

        void compact()
        Compacts this buffer unit by dropping all the data before the current position.

        This buffer unit's start is set to start + position. Its size is set to remaining(). Its position and mark are set to zero.

      • skip

        int skip(int n)
        Skips over the next Math.min(n, remaining()) bytes. If n is negative, no bytes are skipped.

        If m is the actual number of bytes are skipped, then position is incremented by m.

        Parameters:
        n - the number of bytes to be skipped
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes skipped

      • getByteBufferForRead

        java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBufferForRead()
        Returns the ByteBuffer associated to this buffer unit, with limit being this unit's (start + size) and position being this unit's (start + position).
        Returns:
        the ByteBuffer as described

      • getByteBufferForRead

        java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBufferForRead(int offset,
                                         int length)
        Returns the ByteBuffer associated to this buffer unit, with limit being this unit's (start + Math.min((offset + length), size)) and position being this unit's (start + offset).
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset, to buffer unit's start, of the first byte to be read in the returned ByteBuffer
        length - the number of bytes available to be read in the returned ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        the ByteBuffer as described

      • getByteBufferForWrite

        java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBufferForWrite()
        Returns the ByteBuffer associated to this buffer unit, with limit being this buffer unit's capacity and position being this buffer unit's (start + size).
        Returns:
        the ByteBuffer as described

      • getBytes

        void getBytes(int srcBegin,
              int srcEnd,
              java.nio.ByteBuffer dst)
        Copies the requested sequence of bytes to the given dst.
        Parameters:
        srcBegin - start copying at this offset
        srcEnd - stop copying at this offset
        dst - the ByteBuffer to copy the data into
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if dst is null.
        Since:
        2.0

      • set

        IUnit set(int index,
          int length,
          java.nio.ByteBuffer src)
        Sets length bytes starting at the specified index to the ones contained in the given byte buffer src.
        Parameters:

        length - the number of bytes from src to set
        src - the bytes from which to set
        Returns:
        this buffer unit
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if src is null.

      • slice

        IUnit slice(int beginIndex,
            int endIndex)
        Creates a new buffer unit whose content is a shared subsequence of this buffer unit's content starting at the given beginIndex and ending at the given endIndex - 1.

        Changes to this buffer unit's content will be visible in the new buffer unit, and vice versa; the two buffer units' start, size, position and mark values will be independent.

        The new buffer unit's start will be this.start() + start, its position will be zero, its size will be end - start , and its mark will be undefined.

        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the beginning offset, inclusive
        endIndex - the ending offset, exclusive
        Returns:
        the new buffer unit
        Since:
        2.2

      • duplicate

        IUnit duplicate()
        Creates a new buffer unit that shares this buffer unit's content.

        Changes to this buffer unit's content will be visible in the new buffer unit, and vice versa; the two buffer units' start, size, position and mark values will be independent.

        The new buffer unit's start, position, size and mark values will be identical to those of this buffer unit.

        Returns:
        the new buffer unit
        Since:
        2.2
